Content:: Mohamed Wali Akeik (Arabic: محمد والي أكيك; born 1950) was the prime minister of the Sahrawi Arab Democratic Republic, which holds a disputed claim over Western Sahara. Akeik was appointed on February 4, 2018 by President Brahim Ghali, succeeding Abdelkader Taleb Omar, who had been serving as Prime Minister since late 2003.[1][2] Wali Akeik was born in 1950 in El Aaiún, the capital of the territory then called Spanish Sahara.[3]  This Western Sahara article is a stub. You can help Wikipedia by expanding it.
